docs.snippet: At 13, the Little League pitcher Mo’ne Davis has become one of America’s most famous athletes, and she is already learning to say “no” to some of the ceaseless media requests....
docs.lead_paragraph: At 13, the Little League pitcher Mo’ne Davis has become one of America’s most famous athletes, and she is already learning to say “no” to some of the ceaseless media requests.
docs.abstract: Mo'ne Davis, who is only 18th girl to have played in 68 years of the Little League World Series and first female pitcher to have thrown a shutout, is one of most-discussed athletes in United States; 13-year-old Davis is taking her fame in stride.

headline.seo: Mo’ne Davis Takes Little League World Series Stardom in Stride
headline.main: Sports Illustrated and, Maybe in a Few Years, a Driver’s License
headline.print_headline: Sports Illustrated, Then Back to Junior High

docs.snippet: The San Francisco Giants on Wednesday became the first team since 1986 to win a protest filed with Major League Baseball, and will now get to resume a rain-shortened game the Chicago Cubs thought they had won....

docs.snippet: Jake Peavy pitched seven solid innings in his fifth start with San Francisco, and the Giants rolled past the Chicago Cubs 8-3 on Wednesday, hours after they won a protest regarding a rain-shortened loss from the night before....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jake Peavy pitched seven solid innings in his fifth start with San Francisco, and the Giants rolled past the Chicago Cubs 8-3 on Wednesday, hours after they won a protest regarding a rain-shortened loss from the night before.

headline.main: Peavy Pitches Giants to 8-3 Win Over Cubs
